newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY SIGNS TAURUS DEAL WITH MICHELIN.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY SIGNS TAURUS DEAL WITH MICHELIN.

text.p: Hungary's state privatisation agency on Wednesday signed an agreement with Compagnie Financiere Michelin (CFM) on the sale of a 90 percent stake in Hungarian tyremaker Taurus Gumiipari Rt.
CFM, the Swiss holding company of France's Michelin, will pay a total $66 million for the stake plus Taurus' debts amounting to 8.26 billion forints, parties of the deal told a news conference.
Michelin undertook to invest $60 million and will maintain the Taurus brandname for at least 80 percent of Taurus' current product range.
Following the transaction APV will offer the remaining 10 percent stake to Taurus employees at a 50 percent discount on the purchase price, APV said in a statement.
Michelin will make a 60-day buy-back offer to employees.
